laboratory_examinations.findings: Homozygous (partial) deletion of the PLOD2 and PLSCR4 gene, located on chromosome 3, band q22.1 to q24, measuring approximately 0.067â€“0.087 Mb in size. Likely non-functional copy of PLOD2; uncertain consequences for PLSCR4.

Confirmed tricuspid valve dysplasia with severe regurgitation. Antegrade flow across the pulmonary valve; restrictive arterial duct. Anterior mitral valve prolapse with mild mitral regurgitation and mild impairment of left ventricular systolic function.
Showed shortened long bones with fixed flexion bilaterally at the elbow, wrist, and knee joints; bilateral talipes.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Serial scans documented severe shortening of the long bones, eventually lagging 10 weeks behind dates at 33 weeks' gestation.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Significant cardiomegaly with enlarged right heart secondary to severe tricuspid valve regurgitation, pulmonary valve insufficiency, and a small arterial duct. Left heart structures normal with preserved biventricular systolic function.
